leschke@... writes:
> Pippi Longstocking. They're funny. They're also unschooling.
> Tia

Oh, my, a trip down memory lane there, I loved those books, can remember big
chunks of the stories, pictures, etc.

Oh, thank you for saying that, I'm gonna go to the library asap and get them.


~Aimee

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-Discussion] funny books
messages.msgSnippet: Hello, I am a lurker but have decided to come out  to add some suggestions as well. My 11 yod loves funny books and goofy characters so I can heartly
messages.messageBody:
Hello,
I am a lurker but have decided to come out <G> to add some suggestions as
well.

My 11 yod loves funny books and goofy characters so I can heartly recommend
The Junie B. Jones series. We are currently starting at the beginning(again)
with book one and will probably run thru the complete series this summer.
She also enjoyed The Ramona series by Beverly Cleary. And don't forget the
Henry books by the same author.
And I must add the Pippi Longstocking books. I know there is more but my
mind is on "fuzzy-lazy-Sunday mode" right now.
Hope this helps

Melissa

messages.messageBody:
Mine loved Captain Underpants. Of course, they love potty humor in
general, so may not apply to you and yours.

Sarah

Hi!
Does anyone have any suggestions for humorous books to read? My kids are

Amie

messages.messageBody:
> Does anyone have any suggestions for humorous books to read? My kids are 6
yrs old. I am looking for chapter books.

Pippi Longstocking. They're funny. They're also unschooling.
Tia

"They that can give up essential liberty to obtain a little temporary safety
deserve neither liberty nor safety." Ben Franklin
leschke@...

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-Discussion] funny books
messages.msgSnippet: **Does anyone have any suggestions for humorous books to read? My kids are 6 yrs old. I am looking for chapter books. ** My son really liked the humor in Half
messages.messageBody:
**Does anyone have any suggestions for humorous books to read? My kids
are 6 yrs old. I am looking for chapter books. **

My son really liked the humor in Half Magic when he was 7. It's not all
humor all the time, but has several funny parts and a funny attitude.
Plus magic.

Betsy

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-Discussion] funny books
messages.msgSnippet: The fantasy books by Edward Eager
messages.messageBody:
<<<Does anyone have any suggestions for humorous books to read? My kids are 6 yrs old. I am looking for chapter books.>>>>

The fantasy books by Edward Eager are pretty funny - I read some aloud to my 7 year old earlier this year. Some titles - Knight's Castle, Half Magic, Magic at the Lake...Leonie
